step: Fix Jest/Axios ESM Parsing Error in App.test.js Integration Test
sub_steps: Edit jest.config.js or package.json jest section in /reactapp/ to add 'transformIgnorePatterns' that covers 'axios' (e.g., transformIgnorePatterns: ['/node_modules/(?!axios)']).
If no jest.config.js exists, create one at /reactapp/jest.config.js with the necessary transform and transformIgnorePatterns settings.
Alternatively, mock 'axios' globally in App.test.js or set up a manual mock in __mocks__/axios.js to avoid ESM import issues in tests.
Ensure that any import statement of 'axios' in test files is handled via jest.mock('axios') before imports in App.test.js to override problematic native ESM import.
If using fetch instead of axios is preferable for the integration test, replace axios in test environment with a fetch mock (such as jest-fetch-mock).
Rerun npm run test:ci to confirm all tests pass.
description: Resolves the Babel/Jest ESM import error for axios by configuring Jest to properly transpile axios or by globally mocking axios in tests, ensuring the App integration test runs without syntax errors.

step: Build, Lint, and Test the Front-End React Application
sub_steps: Run npm install in /reactapp/ to install dependencies.
Build the application with npm run build.
Lint code with npx eslint src/ --fix.
Run Jest tests with npm run test:ci and resolve any failures.
description: Verifies integrity of the entire React+Jest UI implementation and ensures all requirements and tests have been met for frontend deliverables.
